channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-5472] LoadIncrementalHFiles loops forever if the target table misses a CF
item.description:
I have some HFiles for two column families 'y','z', but I specified a target table that only has CF 'y'.
I see the following repeated forever.
...
12/02/23 22:57:37 WARN mapreduce.LoadIncrementalHFiles: Attempt to bulk load region containing into table z with files [family:y path:hdfs://bunnypig:9000/bulk/z2/y/bd6f1c3cc8b443fc9e9e5fddcdaa3b09, family:z path:hdfs://bunnypig:9000/bulk/z2/z/38f12fdbb7de40e8bf0e6489ef34365d] failed. This is recoverable and they will be retried.
12/02/23 22:57:37 DEBUG client.MetaScanner: Scanning .META. starting at row=z,,00000000000000 for max=2147483647 rows using org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.HConnectionManager$HConnectionImplementation@7b7a4989
12/02/23 22:57:37 INFO mapreduce.LoadIncrementalHFiles: Split occured while grouping HFiles, retry attempt 1596 with 2 files remaining to group or split
12/02/23 22:57:37 INFO mapreduce.LoadIncrementalHFiles: Trying to load hfile=hdfs://bunnypig:9000/bulk/z2/y/bd6f1c3cc8b443fc9e9e5fddcdaa3b09 first=r last=r
12/02/23 22:57:37 INFO mapreduce.LoadIncrementalHFiles: Trying to load hfile=hdfs://bunnypig:9000/bulk/z2/z/38f12fdbb7de40e8bf0e6489ef34365d first=r last=r
12/02/23 22:57:37 DEBUG mapreduce.LoadIncrementalHFiles: Going to connect to server region=z,,1330066309814.d5fa76a38c9565f614755e34eacf8316., hostname=localhost, port=60020 for row
...
item.summary: LoadIncrementalHFiles loops forever if the target table misses a CF

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: In such a case, should the tool ignore the missing column family, or just error out?

Hmm... That's a good question. It could either continue with a loud warning or fail.
I would probably lean on the side of failing, as one might miss the warning.

Maybe there should be an option to optionally specify which families to import.

Hi Buddies,

I encounter the same issue today, in my case I just incorrectly use "cf" when the family name is actually "CF", then when bulkload starts the warning message loops and filled-up my screen, while it's actually useless at all.

I agree with Lars that it should fail with message explicitly tell user no mapping for the given family-name/column-name

+      // check whetehr there is invalid family names in hfiles to be bulkload

'to be bulkload' -> 'to be bulkloaded'


+        throw new RuntimeException(

doBulkLoad() may throw IOException. How about throwing IOException above ? Please include the names of invalid families in exception message.

with the attached patch, when the generated hfile includes invalid column family, the output of bulkload would be like:

13/04/21 20:47:25 ERROR mapreduce.LoadIncrementalHFiles: Unmatched family names found, unmatched family names in hfiles to be bulkload: [CF], valid family names of table t2 are: [cf]
13/04/21 20:47:25 ERROR mapreduce.LoadIncrementalHFiles: -------------------------------------------------
Bulk load aborted with some files not yet loaded:
-------------------------------------------------
hdfs://9.125.91.85:9000/testBulkload/CF/b7fadfd7d188496cae412862170ea713

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:60)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:37)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:611)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.Driver.main(Driver.java:51)
...
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Bulkload failed because invalid family name found in bulkload target hfiles, please check your codes if the hfiles are manually generated.
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.LoadIncrementalHFiles.doBulkLoad(LoadIncrementalHFiles.java:223)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.LoadIncrementalHFiles.run(LoadIncrementalHFiles.java:720)
at org.apache.hadoop.util.ToolRunner.run(ToolRunner.java:65)
at org.apache.hadoop.util.ToolRunner.run(ToolRunner.java:79)
...

My testing steps are:

1) Create a table with single column family in name of "cf"

2) HADOOP_CLASSPATH=`${HBASE_HOME}/bin/hbase classpath` ${HADOOP_HOME}/bin/hadoop jar /opt/ibm/biginsights/hbase/hbase-VERSION.jar importtsv -Dimporttsv.columns=HBASE_ROW_KEY,CF:a,CF:b \

-Dimporttsv.bulk.output=hdfs://9.125.91.85:9000/testBulkload -Dimporttsv.separator=, t2 /tmp/bulkload

3) HADOOP_CLASSPATH=`${HBASE_HOME}/bin/hbase classpath` ${HADOOP_HOME}/bin/hadoop jar /opt/ibm/biginsights/hbase/hbase-VERSION.jar completebulkload hdfs://9.125.91.85:9000/testBulkload t2

Thanks Ted for the comments! Please help review the updated patch.

With the -v2 patch, output of bulkload would be like:

13/04/21 21:26:33 ERROR mapreduce.LoadIncrementalHFiles: Unmatched family names found, unmatched family names in hfiles to be bulkload: [CF], valid family names of table t2 are: [cf]
13/04/21 21:26:33 ERROR mapreduce.LoadIncrementalHFiles: -------------------------------------------------
Bulk load aborted with some files not yet loaded:
-------------------------------------------------
gpfs:/testBulkload/CF/c35f11f4c24d4480960636b9b8907fbb

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:60)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:37)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:611)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.Driver.main(Driver.java:51)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:60)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:37)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:611)
at org.apache.hadoop.util.RunJar.main(RunJar.java:156)
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Bulkload failed because invalid family name found in bulkload target hfiles, invalid family names: [CF], valid family names of table t2 are: [cf]. Please check your codes if the hfiles are manually generated.
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.LoadIncrementalHFiles.doBulkLoad(LoadIncrementalHFiles.java:223)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.LoadIncrementalHFiles.run(LoadIncrementalHFiles.java:725)
at org.apache.hadoop.util.ToolRunner.run(ToolRunner.java:65)
at org.apache.hadoop.util.ToolRunner.run(ToolRunner.java:79)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.LoadIncrementalHFiles.main(LoadIncrementalHFiles.java:730)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:60)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:37)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:611)
at org.apache.hadoop.util.ProgramDriver$ProgramDescription.invoke(ProgramDriver.java:68)
at org.apache.hadoop.util.ProgramDriver.driver(ProgramDriver.java:139)
... 10 more

Minor comments:


+            "Bulkload failed because invalid family name found in bulkload target hfiles, invalid family names: "

The above line is longer than 100 characters. Please wrap.


+                + ". Please check your codes if the hfiles are manually generated.");

'codes' -> 'code'
'hfiles' -> 'HFiles'
Thanks Ted for the further comments, have refined the codes in the updated patch.

The patches are for 0.94 code base. Can you generate trunk patch and run through Hadoop QA ?

Thanks

Hi there Yu Li. As Ted says, despite your patch file name saying "trunk," it appears to be against an 0.94 source tree. Please rebase accordingly. It would also be great if you could add a test case that looks for the exception. TestLoadIncrementalHFiles#testNonexistentColumnFamilyLoad() appears to already test for this scenario. Maybe you can update it to be more robust?

Hi Ted and Nick,

Thanks for the careful review, it's my fault that I changed the codebase to 0.94 for some other work and forgot to change it back when updating the patch.

The updated patch is re-based on trunk

Hi Nick and Ted,

Per Nick's comment, the new -v3 patch has refined TestLoadIncrementalHFiles#testNonexistentColumnFamilyLoad to make it more robust, please help review, thanks.

Please also let me know if the patch looks good, I'll submit the patch to make it run through Hadoop QA.

Hello all,

Since it's probably night on your site, I'd like to submit the patch and let it run through Hadoop QA first to see whether any issue to resolve, please feel free to let me know if any review points when you're back, thanks.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12579791/HBASE-5472-trunk-v3.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.TestAtomicOperation

This message is automatically generated.

Hi all,

I checked the test report, it failed on TestAtomicOperation#testMultiRowMutationMultiThreads. I checked the code path of this test case, and don't think modification in the v3 patch would affect this case(it's irrelavant to bulkload). Also, I have run the test case in my local env with below command, and it passed w/o error, so I personally think it's only an intermittent failure not brought by patch attached here.

mvn -Dtest=TestAtomicOperation#testMultiRowMutationMultiThreads test

@Ted and @Nick, looking forward to your further comments, thanks.

+    // family name in HFiles are invalid

Please make the plurality of 'name' and 'are' consistent.


+      // further check whether the exception message is correct

+      String errMsg = e.getMessage();

+      String expectedMsg = "invalid family name found";

Can you define expectedMsg in LoadIncrementalHFiles as package private variable and reference it from the test ?
That way the chance of the test being broken in the future is lower.

Thanks Ted for the careful review!

I've just refined the patch according to your comments, please help review, thx.

Hi stack,

I checked the testReport of Hadoop QA and found below lines in the error ourput of test result:

Incorrect exception message, expected message: [invalid family name found], current message: [Unmatched family names found: unmatched family names in HFiles to be bulkloaded: [myfam, myfam]; valid family names of table mytable_testNonexistentColumnFamilyLoad are: [MYFAM]]

and this is caused by merging the messages w/o changing the expected message in the test case. I resolved this issue in the v6 patch I attached, as well as the line length exceed 100 character issue.
Resubmit the patch to ask Hadoop QA run through it
